ARABIC: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّٱلَّذِينَ هُم مُّحْسِنُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Allah is with those who have taqwa of Him and with those who are good-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: God is verily with those who are pious and devout, and those who are doers of good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: For surely Allah is with those who hold Him in fear and do good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: God is certainly with the pious and the righteous ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed Allah is with the pious and the virtuous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Truly, Allah is with those who have Taqwa, and the doers of good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely Allah is with those who guard (against evil) and those who do good (to others).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely God is with those who are godfearing, and those who are good-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! Allah is with those who keep their duty unto Him and those who are doers of good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: for God is with those who are righteous and those who do good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily Allah is with those who fear and those who are well- doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed Allah is with those who are Godwary and those who are virtuous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For Allah is with those who restrain themselves, and those who do good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Truly, Allah is with those who fear Him (keep their duty unto Him), and those who are Muhsinun (good-doers, - see the footnote of V. 9:120).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Allah is with the cautious and those who do good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: God is with those who are righteous and those who are virtuous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [16:128] Truly God is with those who fear, [falling into] unbelief and [committing] acts of disobedience, and those who are virtuous, by way of obedience and patience, [granting them] assistance and victory. Meccan, except for verses 26, 33 [or 32], 57, and from 73 to the end of 80, which are Medinese; it consists of 111 verses and was revealed after [sūrat] al-Qasas.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! Allah is with those who keep their duty unto Him) those who ward off disbelief, idolatry and indecencies 297 (and those who are doers of good) in their speech and action and further profess Allah's divine Oneness'. And of the surah in which the Children of Israel are mentioned, which is Meccan in its entirety-except for the verses concerning the news of the delegation of Thaqif and the story when the Jews said "this is not a land of prophets" upon which Allah said: (And they indeed wished to scare thee from the land that they might drive thee forth from thence, and then they would have stayed (there) but a little after thee. (Such was Our) method in the case of those whom We sent before thee (to mankind), and thou wilt not find for Our method aught of power to change. Establish worship at the going down of the sun until the dark of night, and (the recital of) the Qur'an at dawn. Lo! (the recital of) the Qur'an at dawn is ever witnessed. And some part of the night awake for it, a largess for thee. It may be that thy Lord will raise thee to a praised estate. And say: My Lord! Cause me to come in with a firm incoming and to go out with a firm outgoing. And give me from Thy presence a sustaining Power) which are Medinan-and it consists of 110 verses, 1,533 words and 6,400 letters: /i 24 Surah 17: The Night Journey (al-lsra') And of the surah in which the Children of Israel are mentioned, which is Meccan in its entirety— except for the verses concerning the news of the delegation of Thaqif and the story when the Jews said "this is not a land of prophets" upon which Allah said: (And they indeed wished to scare thee from the land that they might drive thee forth from thence, and then they would have stayed (there) but a little after thee. (Such was Our) method in the case of those whom We sent before thee (to mankind), and thou wilt not find for Our method aught of power to change. Establish worship at the going down of the sun until the dark of night, and (the recital of) the Qur'an at dawn. Lo! (the recital of) the Qur'an at dawn is ever witnessed. And some part of the night awake for it, a largess for thee. It may be that thy Lord will raise thee to a praised estate. And say: My Lord! Cause me to come in with a firm incoming and to go out with a firm outgoing. And give me from Thy presence a sustaining Power) which are Medinan— and it consists of 110 verses, 1,533 words and 6,400 letters:
